bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John A. Owen, Jr., December 15, 1947

div1.p: Hench informs Owen that Moran will be attending the Walter Reed Memorial Day of the International Congress on Tropical Medicine, in Washington, D.C.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John A. Owen, Jr., December 15, 1947
div1.opener:
December 15, 1947
Mr. John A. Owen, Jr.
President, Virginia Alpha Chapter
University of Virginia, Department of Medicine
Charlottesville, Virginia
My dear Mr. Owen:
div1.p:
The enclosed letter was dictated before I
received yours but not written until after receiving
yours. I am glad indeed that the talk was what you
wanted. If you do anything more about the honorary
memberships, may I mention again that Mr. John J. Moran
is coming to Washington as a specially invited guest
to attent the “Walter Reed Memorial Day” of the Inter-
national Congress on Tropical Medicine, Washington, D. C.,
May 18. As I understand it, the International Congress
is paying his way to Washington.

In my letter dated the 11th, I asked you
for four photographs. Thank you very much for sending
me the one. Would it be possible for you to get me
three more but I do not want you to spend the money
for the large size. Three regular contact prints would
be sufficient and I would be delighted to pay you for
them. While you are about it, will you ask them to
make me six contact prints? I wish to send three or
four to the relatives of Walter Reed as I want them
to see what I am doing with the material they so
kindly put in my custody.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
